title: Problem Overview
content: **Erdős Problem #259** asks whether ∑ μ(n)² · n/2ⁿ is irrational. Since μ(n)² = 1 iff n is squarefree, this is really asking about sums over squarefree numbers. Chen and Ruzsa proved it in 1999.
mathContext: The Möbius function μ(n) is central to analytic number theory, appearing in the prime number theorem and Möbius inversion. The condition μ(n)² = 1 characterizes squarefree numbers.

title: Möbius Function Abbreviation
content: We define `moebiusFn` as an abbreviation for `ArithmeticFunction.moebius`, the Möbius function from Mathlib.

title: μ(1) = 1
content: The Möbius function satisfies μ(1) = 1. This is the base case for the multiplicative function.
mathContext: By definition, μ(1) = 1 since 1 has zero prime factors (k=0, so (-1)^0 = 1).

title: Möbius Function Examples
content: Computed examples: μ(2) = μ(3) = μ(5) = -1 (primes), μ(4) = μ(9) = 0 (have squared factors), μ(6) = μ(10) = 1 (products of 2 distinct primes).
mathContext: These verify the Möbius function definition using `native_decide`, which evaluates decidable propositions at compile time.

title: 1 is Squarefree
content: The number 1 is squarefree. This is a base case — no prime squared can divide 1.

title: Squarefree ↔ μ(n) ≠ 0
content: **Key characterization**: n is squarefree if and only if μ(n) ≠ 0. This connects the Möbius function to squarefreeness.
mathContext: Uses Mathlib's `moebius_ne_zero_iff_squarefree`. When n has a squared prime factor, μ(n) = 0; otherwise μ(n) = ±1.

title: μ(n)² as Indicator
content: **Indicator property**: μ(n)² equals 1 if n is squarefree, 0 otherwise. This makes μ(n)² the indicator function for squarefree numbers.
mathContext: The sum ∑ μ(n)² · n/2ⁿ therefore equals ∑_{squarefree n} n/2ⁿ.

title: Series Term Definition
content: The n-th term of the series is μ(n)² · n / 2ⁿ. This is nonzero only when n is squarefree.
mathContext: Defined as `(moebiusFn n : ℝ)² * n / 2^n`. The cast to ℝ is needed for the irrationality statement.

title: Series Convergence
content: The series converges absolutely. Since |μ(n)²| ≤ 1 and n/2ⁿ → 0 exponentially, the sum ≤ ∑ n/2ⁿ = 2.
mathContext: Stated as an axiom since we focus on the irrationality result, not the convergence proof.

title: Chen-Ruzsa Theorem
content: **Chen-Ruzsa (1999)**: The sum ∑ μ(n)² · n/2ⁿ is irrational. More strongly, ANY infinite subseries over squarefree numbers is irrational.
mathContext: Stated as an axiom since the proof uses transcendence theory techniques beyond current Mathlib formalization.

title: Erdős Problem #259
content: **Main Result**: The sum ∑ μ(n)² · n/2ⁿ is irrational. This follows directly from the Chen-Ruzsa theorem.
mathContext: The statement `Irrational (∑' n, (moebiusFn n)² * n / 2^n)` is exactly Erdős's original question.

title: Alternative Statement
content: Alternative formulation using tsum notation: directly states the tsum is irrational.
mathContext: Uses `series_summable.hasSum` to convert between HasSum and tsum formulations.
